reference.title: SYSDEPENDS system table
reference.shortdesc: The SYSDEPENDS table stores the dependency relationships between persistent objects in the database.

section.p: Persistent objects can be dependents or providers. Dependents are objects that depend on other objects. Providers are objects that other objects depend on.

ul.li: Dependents are views, constraints, or triggers.
Providers are tables, conglomerates, constraints, or privileges.

section.p: The following table shows the contents of the SYSDEPENDS system table.

table.title: SYSDEPENDS system table
table.desc: For each column in the SYSDEPENDS system table, this table provides its data type, its length in bytes, whether it is nullable, and a description of its contents.

row.entry: A unique identifier for the dependent

entry.p: This class is not part of the public API.

row.entry: A system type that describes the view, constraint, or trigger that is the dependent
A unique identifier for the provider

entry.p: This class is not part of the public API.

row.entry: A system type that describes the table, conglomerate, constraint, and privilege that is the provider
